GRID

Adam H Sparks

Using fetch_DEM

Fetch a digital elevation model (DEM) from WorldClim data, aggregate to 1 arc degree and crop at -60/60 degrees latitude and return a spatial object in the current R session.

DEM <- fetch_DEM()

Fetch a digital elevation model (DEM) from WorldClim data and aggregate to 1 arc degree.

DEM <- fetch_DEM()

Fetch a digital elevation model (DEM) from WorldClim data, aggregate to 15 arc minutes and crop at -60/60 degrees latitude and save a GeoTIFF file of the resulting DEM to local disk.

DEM <- fetch_DEM(resolution = .25, dsn = "~/GSOD")

Using fetch_GSOD

Fetch GSOD data for 1998 to 2000.

gsod <- fetch_GSOD(years = 1998:2000)

Using interpolate_gsod with a list of data frames

Using interpolate_gsod with a list of CSV files

Example 1: Saving all Files to Local Disk

Example 2: Using In-Memory Data Only

# Create a list of GSOD files
gsod_list <- fetch_GSOD(years = 1998:1999)

# Fetch and aggregate the raster digital elevation model
dem <- fetch_DEM()

# Run the function for MAX and MIN temperature
lapply(X = gsod_list, FUN = interp, dem = dem, vars = c("MAX", "MIN"))
